    • Method Detail

      • getMovies

        public java.util.List<Movie> getMovies(User user,
                              java.lang.Boolean seen)
        Retrieves a list of movies the user has stored, or a list of all users movies if the user is admin.
        Parameters:
        user - User, whose movies are retrieved. If user is admin (User.isAdmin() returns true) all users' movies are retrieved.
        seen - Retrieves only movies with the same value on seen. If parameter is null it is ignored.
        Returns:
        A list of movies, or null if the database query fails.

      • getByName

        public java.util.List<Movie> getByName(User user,
                              java.lang.String search,
                              java.lang.Boolean seen)
        Retrieves a list of the user's movies with a name corresponding to the search term, or a list of all users movies if the user is admin.
        Parameters:
        user - User, whose movies are retrieved. If user is admin (User.isAdmin() returns true) all users movies are retrieved.
        search - Search term, which is compared to movie names. If the search term consists of many words (separated by white spaces) all the search terms are matches (by AND).
        seen - Retrieves only movies with the same value on seen. If parameter is null it is ignored.
        Returns:
        A list of movies, or null if the database query fails.

      • getByGenre

        public java.util.List<Movie> getByGenre(User user,
                               java.lang.String genre,
                               java.lang.Boolean seen)
        Retrieves a list of the user's movies with a genre corresponding to the search term, or a list of all users movies if the user is admin.
        Parameters:
        user - User, whose movies are retrieved. If user is admin (User.isAdmin() returns true) all users movies are retrieved.
        genre - Search term, which is compared to movie genres.
        seen - Retrieves only movies with the same value on seen. If parameter is null it is ignored.
        Returns:
        A list of movies, or null if the database query fails.

      • getByMediaFormat

        public java.util.List<Movie> getByMediaFormat(User user,
                                     java.lang.String mediaformat,
                                     java.lang.Boolean seen)
        Retrieves a list of the user's movies with a media format corresponding to the search term, or a list of all users movies if the user is admin.
        Parameters:
        user - User, whose movies are retrieved. If user is admin (User.isAdmin() returns true) all users movies are retrieved.
        mediaformat - Search term, which is compared to movies' media formats.
        seen - Retrieves only movies with the same value on seen. If parameter is null it is ignored.
        Returns:
        A list of movies, or null if the database query fails.

      • addMovie

        public boolean addMovie(User user,
               Movie movie)
        Adds a movie to the database.
        Parameters:
        user - The movie's owner.
        movie - Movie to be stored.
        Returns:
        true if movie was successfully added, otherwise false.

      • getById

        public Movie getById(int movieid)
        Retrieves the movie with the given movieid from the database.
        Parameters:
        movieid - Id of the movie.
        Returns:
        A movie, or null if the database query fails.

      • removeMovie

        public boolean removeMovie(int movieid)
        Permanently deletes the movie with the given movieid from the database.
        Parameters:
        movieid - Id of the movie.
        Returns:
        true if information was successfully added, otherwise false.

      • updateMovie

        public boolean updateMovie(Movie movie,
                  int movieid)
        Updates the information of the given movie in the database.
        Parameters:
        movie - Movie with the information to be updated.
        movieid - Id of the movie to be updated.
        Returns:
        true if information was successfully added, otherwise false.
